para: Copy an existing &mesh;. The new &mesh; has the same &skel; and µ as the old &mesh;, as well as the same types of finite elements.

If copy_field is true, then the new &mesh; will have the same defined and active &fields; as the original &mesh;, and the &fields; will have the same values. If copy_field is false, then no &fields; will be defined in the new &mesh;.

If copy_bc is true, then boundary conditions will be copied from the old &mesh; to the new. It it is false, the new &mesh; will not have any boundary conditions. It will have boundaries, though, because boundaries are defined in the &skel;.
